str2: One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From para and the middle voice of aiteo; to beg off, i.e. Deprecate, decline, shun.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
First, before, principal, most important. Contracted superlative of pro; foremost.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To buy. From agora; properly, to go to market, i.e. to purchase; specially, to redeem.
From ago; a field; genitive case, the country; specially, a farm, i.e. Hamlet.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
From ana and the base of agkale; constraint; by implication, distress.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Apparently from ereo; to interrogate; by implication, to request.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and the middle voice of aiteo; to beg off, i.e. Deprecate, decline, shun.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
